actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

actions.text: Mr. Sawyer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Gilman demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 3195 proposed by Senator Graham for Senator Glenn.
Amendment SP 3195 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To redesignate the Midland General Mail Facility in Midland, Texas, as the "Carl O. Hyde General Mail Facility".

summary.text: Redesignates the Midland General Mail Facility, located at 10000 Sloan Field Boulevard, in Midland, Texas, as the Carl O. Hyde General Mail Facility. Amends the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to exempt all Federal officers and employees other than Members of the House of Representatives and noncareer officers or employees whose rate of basic pay is above GS-15 from the ban on honoraria imposed by the Ethics Reform Act of 1989 if: (1) the subject of the appearance, speech, or article for which the honorarium is offered is unrelated to official Government duties or status as a Federal officer or employee; and (2) the offeror of the honorarium has no interests that may be substantially affected by the performance or nonperformance of the recipient's official duties. Prohibits the amount of such honorarium accepted from exceeding the usual and customary fee for the services for which the honorarium is paid, up to $2,000. Subjects the acceptance of any honorarium to financial disclosure under the Ethics in Government Act of 1978.

titles.title: To redesignate the Midland General Mail Facility in Midland, Texas, as the "Carl O. Hyde General Mail Facility".
